comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://chzzk.naver.com/video/9459973](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchzzk.naver.com%2Fvideo%2F9459973) ### Comment > **Title:** > [Adblock] Ads on the Korean streaming site Chzzk (chzzk.naver.com) are not blocked > > **Body:** > > **1. Environment** > * **OS:** Windows 11 > * **Browser:** Chrome (Version: 140.0.7339.208) > * **AdGuard Version:** AdGuard Chrome Extension (Version: 5.1.148) > > **2. Problem Description** > AdGuard fails to block ads on the South Korean live streaming site Chzzk ([https://chzzk.naver.com/](https://chzzk.naver.com/)). Skippable video ads are displayed at the beginning of streams (pre-roll) and in the middle of viewing (mid-roll). > > **3. Steps to Reproduce** > 1. Launch the Chrome browser with the AdGuard extension enabled. > 2. Go to `https://chzzk.naver.com/video/9459973` or any other live streaming channel. > 3. A pre-roll ad is displayed just before the stream starts. > 4. After watching for about 10-15 minutes, a mid-roll ad is displayed again. > > **4. Expected Behavior** > Both pre-roll and mid-roll ads should be blocked, and the stream's content should play immediately. > > **5. Actual Behavior** > **5-1. Ads are not blocked** > The ads are not blocked and are displayed as normal. A video ad with a "SKIP" button plays, as can be seen in the attached screenshot. > > **5-2. Anti-Adblock message is displayed** > Additionally, when watching a live stream, the site detects that AdGuard is active and displays a warning message asking the user to disable the extension. The message can be dismissed by clicking a confirmation button, but it reappears every time the page is refreshed. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/numo11dhq34cg44cwc0scc80cs0s8wajxswa33w408.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/edk5lnhyphs8s0wcg40os8g44k04ocgh41vh6m9l54.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.148 MV3 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist

Estonian List,
List-KR ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.1.148&system_version=Windows+11&manifest_version=3&browser=chrome&filters=2.3.4.208.218.227&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=false)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
Ok I think I know what causes it.
Using NordVPN might be the issue here.
Then it stays until I clear cookies.

issue.title: pay.emag.ro
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://pay.emag.ro](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fpay.emag.ro)
### Comment
